SENT.plain: A 1-day-old boy with the characteristics of Adams-Oliver syndrome was presented
Adams-Oliver syndrome has a wide spectrum of anomalies ranging from aplasia cutis congenita, cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita and transverse limb defects to lethal anomalies
Our patient had aplasia cutis congenita with scalp, skull and dura defect
He had also a large dura defect with herniation of brain tissue
Besides these he had bilateral clubfoot, cortical fissure and nail hypoplasia in the hands, scrotal hyperpigmentation and generalized cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita
He was operated on the 3rd day of life
The herniated brain tissue was resected and the dura was repaired with a synthetic dural graft
